1: It does not belong to us, Lord. The praise belongs to you because of your love and loyalty.
2: Why do the nations ask, “Where is their God?”
3: Our God is in heaven. He does what he wants.
4: Their idols are made of silver and gold. They are made by human hands.
5: They have mouths, but they cannot speak. They have eyes, but they cannot see.
6: They have ears, but they cannot hear. They have noses, but they cannot smell.
7: They have hands, but they cannot feel. They have feet, but they cannot walk. And no sounds come from their throats.
8: The people who make idols and trust them are all like them.
9: Family of Israel, trust the Lord. He is your helper and your protection.
10: Family of Aaron, trust the Lord. He is your helper and your protection.
11: You people who fear the Lord should trust him. He is your helper and your protection.
12: The Lord remembers us and will bless us. He will bless the family of Israel. He will bless the family of Aaron.
13: The Lord will bless those who fear him, from the smallest to the greatest.
14: May the Lord give you many children. And may he give them children also.
15: May the Lord bless you. He made heaven and earth.
16: Heaven belongs to the Lord. But he gave the earth to people.
17: Dead people do not praise the Lord. Those in the grave are silent.
18: But we will praise the Lord now and forever. Praise the Lord!
